= Components =

|| *Component Code* || *Component Name* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| *BMA.MM.PT.PTA* || Anterior Pretectum Nucleus || Mediate somatosensory and nociceptive information || 3 parallel flows from MC, anterior interpositus nucleus of TH, GR to dorsal accessory IO ||
|| *BMA.HP.PVR* || Parvocellular Reticular Nucleus || Flow of respiratory current out of organism || Projects to facial nucleus, hypoglossal nucleus and parabrachial nucleus ||
|| *BMA.HP.PB* || Parabrachial Nucleus || Source of short-latency nociceptive input || ||
|| *BMA.HP.VB* || Vestibular Nucleus || Equilibrium, Postural Reflexes || Pons ||
|| *BMA.HM.IO* || Inferior Olivary Nucleus || Proprioception Relay from Spinal Cord to Cerebellum || ||
|| *BMA.HM.CU* || Cuneate Nucleus || Carry fine touch and proprioceptive information from upper body || ||
|| *BMA.HM.GR* || Gracile Nucleus || Carry epicritic, kinesthetic, and conscious proprioceptive information from lower body || ||
|| *BMA.HM.ARC* || Medullary Arcuate Nucleus || Controlling respiratory frequency || Receives fibers from spitothalamic tract and sends to CR ||
|| *BMA.SC.MG* || Marginal Nucleus || || Relay information related to pain and temperature sensation || Pain sensation cannot be modulated ||
|| *BMA.SC.SG* || Substantia Gelatinosa || || Relay for C-fibers of slowly conducting, poorly localized pain sensation || Second of two after proprius 1-order neurons ||
|| *BMA.SC.NP* || Proprius Nucleus || || Relay light touch, pain and temperature information || With Clarke's Nucleus sensing fine touch and proprioception ||
|| *BMA.SC.CL* || Clarke's Nucleus || Major relay to CR for unconscious proprioception || Posterior thoracic nucleus ||
